text: Which compound contains the highest percentage of magnesium by mass?

In the diagram above the paired open spheres represent H2 molecules and the paired solid spheres represent N2 molecules. When the molecules in the box react to form the maximum possible amount of ammonia (NH3) molecules, what is the limiting reactant and how many molecules of NH3 can be formed?

options.A: N2 is limiting. 5 molecules of NH3 can be formed.
options.B: N2 is limiting. 10 molecules of NH3 can be formed.
options.C: H2 is limiting. 8 molecules of NH3 can be formed.
options.D: H2 is limiting.12 molecules of NH3 can be formed.

text: Vanillin, C8H8O3 (M = 152 g/mol), is the molecule responsible for the vanilla flavor in food. How many oxygen atoms are present in a 45.0 mg sample of vanillin?
Which of the following is a weak electrolyte in aqueous solution?
Which list gives nonmetals that are found in their elemental forms in nature?
Which one of the following cannot act as an oxidizing agent?
Which substance is the primary component in stalactites and stalagmites in caves?

Five successive determinations of the density of an alloy gave the following results: 10.29 g/mL, 9.95 g/mL, 10.06 g/mL, 9.89 g/mL, 10.18 g/mL What value should be reported for the density of this alloy?
How are values for TS, SS and DS (per 25 mL water) determined?

options.A: TS = mass 1, SS = mass 1 – mass 2, DS = mass 2
options.B: TS = mass 1, SS = mass 2, DS = mass 1 – mass 2
options.C: TS = mass 1 + mass 2, SS = mass 1, DS = mass 2
options.D: TS = mass 1 + mass 2, SS = mass 2, DS = mass 1

text: Which method(s) can be used to determine the concentration of HNO3 in an aqueous solution of nitric acid? I titration with a standard base II titration with a standard oxidizing agent III precipitation with Ag+
The kinetic theory of gases assumes all of the following EXCEPT:

options.A: Gases are composed of particles in random, ceaseless motion.
options.B: The sizes of gas particles are negligible compared to the size of the container.
options.C: Gas particles do not attract or repel each other.
options.D: When gas particles collide, kinetic energy is lost.

The molecules in a sample of pure liquid dichloromethane, CH2Cl2, experience which of the following intermolecular forces? I dispersion forces II dipole-dipole forces III hydrogen bonding
Which property best distinguishes metals from other types of solids?

options.C: Metals have a shiny, silvery-white appearance.

text: What type of solid is silicon carbide, SiC?

The normal boiling point and vapor pressure at 25 °C are measured for liquids in two flasks. Flask A contains pure water and flask B contains a 1.0 M aqueous NaCl solution. Which flask contains the liquid with the higher boiling point? Which flask contains the liquid with the higher vapor pressure? Higher boiling point Higher vapor pressure
Consider the following reactions I 2 NO2(g)  N2(g) + 2 O2(g) II 2 IBr(g)  I2(s) + Br2(l) For which reaction is ΔS° < 0?

Liquid water is injected into an oven at 400 K. What are the signs for G, H, and S for the physical transformation that occurs? G H S

A device used to test alcohol in the bloodstream uses the reaction 2 K2Cr2O7(aq) + 8 H2SO4(aq) + 3 CH3CH2OH(aq)  2 Cr2(SO4)3(aq) + 2 K2SO4(aq) + 3 CH3COOH(aq) + 11 H2O If the rate of disappearance of K2Cr2O7 is 1.24 M/min what is the rate of disappearance of CH3CH2OH?

options.A: decrease size of the graphite pieces

A first-order reaction is carried out at several different temperatures. The data are plotted as ln k vs 1/T. How is the slope of the graph related to Ea?
Which statement about the behavior of a catalyst is correct?

options.A: A catalyst reacts with the product and shifts the equilibrium to the right speeding up the reaction.
options.B: A catalyst lowers the activation energy of the original reaction pathway.
options.C: A catalyst provides additional energy to a reactant so it can achieve the necessary activation energy.
options.D: A catalyst provides an alternative reaction pathway with a lower activation energy. Questions 31 and 32 should be answered with reference to the equation 2 C(s) + O2(g) 2 CO(g) ∆H < 0

text: What is the equilibrium expression for the reaction represented by the equation above?

An endothermic reaction has a positive value for ∆S. Which of the following is true about the equilibrium constant for this reaction?

options.A: It may be greater than 1 only at low temperatures.
options.B: It may be greater than 1 only at high temperatures.
options.C: It is greater than 1 at all temperatures.
options.D: It is less than 1 at all temperatures.

text: Phosphoric acid, H3PO4, establishes the following equilibria in aqueous solution. H3PO4(aq) + H2O(l) H3O+(aq) + H2PO4–(aq) K1 H HP2P OO 44 2– –( (a aq q) ) + + H H2 2O O( (l l) ) H H3 3O O+ +( (a aq q) ) + + H PP OO 434–2 (– a( qa )q ) K K2 3 What is the relationship among the K values?
Which pair of solutes could be used to prepare an aqueous buffer solution with a pH < 7?
What will be the result when 15.0 mL of 0.040 M lead(II) nitrate is mixed with 15.0 mL of 0.040 M sodium chloride? PbCl2(s) Pb2+(aq) + 2 Cl– (aq) [Ksp = 1.7 × 10–5]

options.A: A clear solution with no precipitate will result.
options.B: Solid PbCl2 will precipitate and excess Pb2+ ions will remain in solution.
options.C: Solid PbCl2 will precipitate and excess Cl– ions will remain in solution.
options.D: Solid PbCl2 will precipitate and no excess ions will remain in solution.

options.A: the same molecular formula but the atoms are bonded in different ways.
options.B: the same molar mass but different atoms in their composition.
options.C: the same physical properties but different chemical properties.
